com.foreach.across.modules.webcms.data

Class AbstractWebCmsDataImporter<T,U>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.foreach.across.modules.webcms.data.AbstractWebCmsDataImporter<T,U>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    WebCmsDataImporter
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractWebCmsAssetImporter, WebCmsComponentImporter, WebCmsDomainImporter, WebCmsMenuImporter, WebCmsRemoteEndpointImporter

    public abstract class AbstractWebCmsDataImporter<T,U>
extends Object
implements WebCmsDataImporter
    Abstract base class for a WebCmsDataImporter that needs to support both map and collection data, as well as the different WebCmsDataImportAction options.

    Each entry to import is expected to represent a single object. Dispatches to the WebCmsPropertyDataImportService for custom property handling. If neither related property handlers have imported anything, nor values on the original asset have been changed, the asset will not be updated.

    Since:
    0.0.2
    Author:
    Arne Vandamme

    • Method Detail

      • importData

        public final void importData(WebCmsDataEntry data)
        Import a single data entry from the original data set. Depending on the original data set the single entry will have a key set or not. If the given data entry results in a new WebCmsDomainBound object, the domain will be prefilled with WebCmsMultiDomainService.getCurrentDomain()
        Specified by:
        importData in interface WebCmsDataImporter
        Parameters:
        data - to import

      • retrieveDomainForDataEntry

        protected WebCmsDomain retrieveDomainForDataEntry(WebCmsDataEntry item,
                                                  Class<?> entityType)
        Retrieves the current domain for the specified data entry and class. If the data entry contains a key, that domain will be returned. If the data entry does not contain a key, the domain will be retrieved using WebCmsMultiDomainService.getCurrentDomainForType(Class)
        Parameters:
        item - the data entry
        entityType - to check domain support
        Returns:
        the domain to which the entity should be attached

      • applyDataValues

        protected boolean applyDataValues(Map<String,Object> values,
                                  U dto)
        Apply the data values to the dto object. The default implementation assumes that the values map with actual dto class properties.

        If this method returns false no values have been applied to the DTO and actual updating might get skipped.

        Parameters:
        values - to apply (key/value pairs)
        dto - to set the values on
        Returns:
        true if the DTO has been modified

      • resolveAction

        protected WebCmsDataAction resolveAction(WebCmsDataImportAction requested,
                                         T existing)
        Resolve the import action into the actual action to perform depending if there's an existing item we're dealing with or not. If this method returns null the processing of the data entry will be skipped.
        Parameters:
        requested - import action
        existing - item or null if none
        Returns:
        action to perform or null if none

      • validateForSaving

        protected final void validateForSaving(U itemToSave)
        This performs validation by building an Errors object, and dispatching to the #validate(T, Errors) method. If actual validation errors are added, this will result in a validation exception.
        Parameters:
        itemToSave - item to be saved

      • prepareForSaving

        protected U prepareForSaving(U itemToBeSaved,
                             WebCmsDataEntry data)
        Override if you want to post process an item before saving. Useful if you want to generate property values for example.
        Parameters:
        itemToBeSaved - original item to be saved
        data - that was used to build the item
        Returns:
        new item to be saved instead - null if saving should be skipped

      • validate

        protected void validate(U itemToBeSaved,
                        org.springframework.validation.Errors errors)
        Perform some custom validation on the item to be saved. If any errors are added to the collection, this will result in a validation exception being thrown.
        Parameters:
        itemToBeSaved - item to be saved
        errors - collection to add validation errors to

      • retrieveExistingInstance

        protected abstract T retrieveExistingInstance(WebCmsDataEntry data)
        Get the existing object that this data represents. If no instance exists, this method should return null..
        Parameters:
        data - entry
        Returns:
        instance or null

      • createDto

        protected abstract U createDto(WebCmsDataEntry data,
                               T existing,
                               WebCmsDataAction action,
                               Map<String,Object> dataValues)
        Create a DTO object for either a new instance or an existing instance. If the existing parameter is null a new instance should be created.

        Note that the DTO should not apply the data entry values yet, but the data entry can be used to determine the initial type of instance that needs to be created.

        If the DTO is null, the import will be skipped but properties will still be called.

        Parameters:
        data - entry
        existing - instance or null if a new instance should be created
        action - purpose for which the DTO should be created (create, delete or replace)
        dataValues - modifiable collection of the data values that will be applied afterwards
        Returns:
        DTO

      • deleteInstance

        protected abstract void deleteInstance(T instance,
                                       WebCmsDataEntry data)
        Perform the delete action on existing instance.
        Parameters:
        instance - to delete
        data - entry that is being imported

      • saveDto

        protected abstract void saveDto(U dto,
                                WebCmsDataAction action,
                                WebCmsDataEntry data)
        Save an updated or created instance.
        Parameters:
        dto - that should be saved
        action - type of save action (create, update or replace)
        data - entry that is being imported

      • addForceUpdateProperty

        protected final void addForceUpdateProperty(Map<String,Object> dataValues)
        Add force update property to a data values map. This will cause the item to be updated, even if nothing else has changed. Mainly used in a REPLACE use case.
        Parameters:
        dataValues - map

      • setPropertyDataImportService

        @Autowired
public void setPropertyDataImportService(WebCmsPropertyDataImportService propertyDataImportService)
